    • constructRays_ThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRays_ThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, double numOfRays)
      instead of returning 1 ray that will return to the pixel's calculation, now i will create a beam of random rays - spread all over the pixel, by random places. this will solute the problem of "sharp edges" how? first I will define the wanted limits, calculate the center ray of the pixel and by than will create a loop that will create the random rays.
      Parameters:
      nX - - pixel's num on X
      nY - - pixel's num on Y
      j - - the Y coordinate of the given pixel
      i - - the X coordinate of the given pixel
      screenDistance - - the distance from the camera to the screen
      screenWidth -
      screenHeight -
      Returns:
      the ray that go through a specific pixel

    • constructAdaptiveRayBeamThroughPixel

      public java.util.LinkedList<Ray> constructAdaptiveRayBeamThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, double cornerTopX, double cornerTopY, double cornerBottomX, double cornerBottomY)
      the improvement for "adaptive super sampling". taking 5 rays - 4 at the edges and one at the center. this is based on the improvement of the "super sampling", but instead of sending a beam of 50 rays - I want to prevebt spare calculation, therefore there will 4 rays in each edge of the pixel - and one at the center for the calculation. constructs adaptive ray beam through a given pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels on the x axis
      nY - number of pixels on the y axis
      j - the given line
      i - the given column
      screenDistance - distance between the camera and the view plane
      screenWidth - the width of the screen
      screenHeight - the height of the screen
      cornerTopX - the double value for the top value of x
      cornerTopY - the double value for the top value of y
      cornerBottomX - the double value for the bottom value of x
      cornerBottomY - the double value for the bottom value of y
      Returns:
      list of rays
